column5: just lookin for some musky huntin info, locations, proper gear, line rods reels, lures, presentation, anything really, i want one of these things this year!

Welcome to the board fisherfellow. I'm feeling generous tonight.  Location: All Kawartha lakes Gear)Line: 65lb Power Pro Rod: Gorilla stick Reel: Abu Garcia 5600C4 Lure: Bucktails Presentation: Fast and Furious over weedbeds  This is what works for me.
Couldn't say it anymore clear  Love the C4!!

Don't forget, large pen style net and bolt cutters for cutting hooks. Also go to any Muskies Canada meeting, you don't have to join to go and you may pick up some great tips. Check their website for a location near you.
thanks for the help everyone, ill be sure to post a pic when i get my first one, shouldnt be long.........

Good luck ! caught one last night on an X-rap fishing for walleye.. beauty fish !  though defenetly look into bucktails.. and a good rod and reel, i preffer more of a low profile baitcast reel, such as the curado 200-300s, or the revo's.  but the other guys defenetly said it, check out musky canada, go to the meetings etc, you can learn so much !
thats awesome meister, were you in scugog?
yes Sir,  just aiming for walleye .. but through out the summer and fall they can sure be a blast to fish for!   ps. where are you looking  to fish for them ?
Remember guys, they don't open for 2 more weeks yet.
anywhere in southern ontario, drivin distance of toronto basically.......

yes sir, and cant wait ! though if you do run into them before open season, say fishing for walleye you should release them immediately, or cut your line !   if you can make it out to Kawartha lakes, such as Scugog, or Rice, you can normally find them all over..
